intro: Persicaria pensylvanica, commonly known as Pennsylvania smartweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist to wet soils, often found in wetlands, stream banks, and roadside ditches. The plant features upright stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a hairy texture. It produces small, pinkish to reddish flowers in clusters at the tips of its stems, which bloom from late spring to early summer. The species is part of the Polygonaceae family, known for its distinctive bracteate inflorescences and often edible species.
